title: Interaction Design for Online Learning Objects: Science Education Based on HCI Framework

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational science concepts and basic digital device usage skills
context.additional_context: A science education program for youth within corporations, combining online platforms and offline workshops in a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) environment, utilizing science experiment simulations and data analysis tools.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the interaction levels of online learning objects by applying the 'Window of Interaction (WoI)' framework from Human-Computer Interaction (HCI).
Learners can identify and explain at least three interaction design principles aligned with science learning objectives.
Learners can improve the interaction characteristics of self-designed online learning objects based on peer feedback through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
